div.p: I am sorry that you so easily give up the poor principality.See 1036. Tower certainly would never do for your family, being much to small: but I was not acquainted with yr number. Mr Panton some time ago returned your Compliments: & mentioned to me a new house built by a clergyman who is ruined by the expence. Itâ€™s situation is the noblest in Britain above Conway in sight of everything that is great. It is unfurnished: but if you could think of a longer retreat than one summer it may suit you. Had you not best make a tour with Miss BullsElizabeth and Catherine. & explore the Country. here you will find warm lodgings as long as you please. This failing I shall be silent.

Pistill Rhaeader is described vol. last p. 350 paragraph 4th.See 1036, n. 3. I am not interested the lest in S. Wales, therefore return Edward's head.This probably refers to Edward II who, although born at Caernarfon Castle, spent a tumultuous period at the end of his reign in south-east Wales. ODNB. I rejoice at the political change; & may say that the pub welsh public strongly befriends in theory but wants principle to give their sentiments, useful effect. Whenever DissolutionParliament was dissolved on 25 March 1784. takes place I fly the country till the bustle is over: for I cannot vote against my conscience: and my conscience tells me Sir R. M. ought not to be supported. Pennant was critical of Roger Mostyn for his support to the Fox-North Coalition from February 1783, since he had promised to 'enlist under no party, follow no set of men'. Literary life, p. 95; Hist P s.n. Sir Roger Mostyn, 5th Bt. I will not hurt the worthiest of women his sister by going against him so shall retire from the scene of action.

Be so good as to refer me to the author who gives the character of sir Benj. wrightSir Benjamin Wright[e] of Cranham Hall (d. 1706) was considered a lunatic; he was put into custody and his estates were taken over. Wellcome Library, MS 7467. in the last century. He is the person to whom Mr Possi was lately compared in the house.
